result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Lee Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant entitled to 1 day credit IF revoked.

miscConds.notes:
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established. 
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. 
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling and/or treatment as recommended by Agent.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
Ignition Interlock shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay $600 fine and costs. All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence forthwith.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

12:57 PM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Lee Hill in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Christopher Lee Hill (not determined); Def. added by jail at 11:30 for jail call - Atty. Findley unaware of same; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 6/16/22 at 8:30am in Br. 4 & Review 6/1/22 at 8:15am in Br. 3; Court sets $1,000.00 PA Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $50 by next court date.
